title: This Hurricane Season Could Be So Bad, We Might Run Out of Names

content:

Not only are tropical cyclones brewing earlier than usual, they are also growing in number … [+3935 chars]

en: This Hurricane Season Could Be So Bad, We Might Run Out of Names. Communities along America's North Atlantic coast are bracing for yet another exceptional hurricane season.
la: Procellae hoc tempore potuit esse tam malum, ut nomina excurreremus. Communitates secundum litus Atlanticum Americae Septentrionalis aliud comprehendunt adhuc eximium tempus tempestatis.

title: The Atlantic Ocean is primed to deliver "high-octane jet fuel for hurricanes"
description: The conditions favoring formation of Atlantic hurricanes are more extreme than ever seen before.
content:
The much anticipated 2024 Atlantic hurricane season is here, and with ocean heat setting records, plus a looming La Niña, it may well take an appalling toll. 
Tropical cyclones are fueled by oceanic… [+4080 chars]
de: Der Atlantische Ozean ist darauf vorbereitet, „hochoktanigen Treibstoff für Hurrikane“ zu liefern. Die Bedingungen, die die Entstehung von Hurrikanen im Atlantik begünstigen, sind extremer als je zuvor.
en: The Atlantic Ocean is primed to deliver "high-octane jet fuel for hurricanes". The conditions favoring formation of Atlantic hurricanes are more extreme than ever seen before.
la: Oceanus Atlanticus ad "octanum jet fomitem procellarum" tradendum paratum est. Conditiones procellarum Atlanticarum formationi faventes magis extremae sunt quam umquam antea.

title: Florida's hurricane season arrives with a rainy deluge
description: The annual rainy season has arrived with a wallop in much of Florida, where a disorganized disturbance of tropical weather from the Gulf of Mexico has caused street flooding and triggered tornado watches but so far has not caused major damage or injuries

en: Florida's hurricane season arrives with a rainy deluge. The annual rainy season has arrived with a wallop in much of Florida, where a disorganized disturbance of tropical weather from the Gulf of Mexico has caused street flooding and triggered tornado watches but so far has not caused major damage or injuries
